Exclusive to datetime, must be UTC.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender
member.summary: Appends logging events to Google Stackdriver Logging.

remarks.para: Logging events are sent to Google Stackdriver Logging asychronously, via a local buffer. This is to ensure that server errors or increased network/server latency don't cause slow-downs in the program being logged.

GoogleStackdriverAppender provides two methods of flushing this local buffer.
The and flush local buffer entries to Google Stackdriver, waiting a maximum of the specified . These methods return true if all locally buffered entries were successfully flushed, or false otherwise.
GoogleStackdriverAppender implements . This calls with the timeout configured in , then closes the appender so no further logging can be performed. It is not generally necessary to call .

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a Google Stackdriver appender.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.FlushAsync(System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Flush locally buffered log entries to the server.
member.param: The maxmimum time to spend waiting for the flush to complete.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A task representing whether the flush completed within the timeout.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.Flush(System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Flush locally buffered log entries to the server.
member.param: The maxmimum time to spend waiting for the flush to complete.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: Whether the flush completed within the timeout.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.Flush(System.Int32)
member.summary: Flush locally buffered log entries to the server.
member.param: The maxmimum time in milliseconds to spend waiting for the flush to complete.
member.returns: Whether the flush completed within the timeout.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose of this appender, by flushing locally buffer entries then closing the appender.
member.remarks: The flush timeout is configured using the DisposeTimeoutSeconds configuration option. This defaults to 30 seconds if not set.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.Label
member.summary: Custom label attached to log events.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.Label.Key
member.summary: Label key.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.Label.Value
member.summary: Label value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.DisableResourceTypeDetection
member.summary: If set, disables resource-type detection based on platform, so ResourceType will default to "global" if not manually set.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.ResourceType
member.summary: The resource type of log entries. Default value depends on the detected platform. See the remarks section for details.
member.remarks:
If this is not set, then Resource type is set depending on the detected execution platform:
Google App Engine: ResourceType "gae_app", with project_id, module_id, and version_id set approprately.
Google Compute Engine: ResourceType "gce_instance", with project_id, instance_id, and zone set approprately.
Unknown: ResourceType "global", with project_id set from this configuration.
If is true, then this platform detection is not performed, and this ResourceType defaults to "global" if not set.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.AddResourceLabel(Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.Label)
member.summary: Specify labels for the resource type; only used if platform detection is disabled or detects an unknown platform.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.ProjectId
member.summary: The project ID for all log entries. Must be configured in not executing on Google Compute Engine or Google App Engine. If running on GCE or GAE, the ProjectId will be automatically detected if not set.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.LogId
member.summary: LogID for all log entries. Must be configured.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.MaxUploadBatchSize
member.summary: The maximum batch size when uploading to Google Cloud Logging. Default value is 100.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.LocalQueueType
member.summary: The local queuing mechanism, used before the log is sent to Google Logging. Defaults to .

remarks.para: All log entries are temporarily queued locally before being uploaded to Google Logging. This is usually for a very brief duration; but if there are problems connecting to Google Logging this local queue allows the application to continue functioning as normal, without blocking on log events or immediately throwing aware log entries.

One queue type is provided:
: Log entries are queued locally in memory. The maximum amount of memory and/or the maximum number of log entries to queue can be configured. If the application exits or crashes before in-memory log entries have been uploaded to Google Logging, then these log entries are permanently lost. If Google Logging becomes temporarily unavailable then the number of log entries queued until Google Logging becomes available again will be limited by the configure maximum sizes; log entries in excess of this configured maximum will cause the oldest queued log entries to be permanently lost.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.MaxMemorySize
member.summary: The maximum bytes of memory used by in-memory logging queue. Default value is 0 (unconfigured). Not used for file-based queuing.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.MaxMemoryCount
member.summary: The maximum count of log entries allowed in the in-memory logging queue. Default value is 1,000 Not used for file-based queueing.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.CredentialFile
member.summary: The file path of a service account JSON file to use for authentication. Not necessary if running on GCE or GAE or if the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable has been set. Must not be set if is set.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.CredentialJson
member.summary: JSON credential for authentication. Not necessary if running on GCE or GAE or if the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable has been set. Must not be set if is set.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.AddCustomLabel(Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.Label)
member.summary: Specify custom labels for all log entries.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.AddWithMetaData(Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.MetaDataType)
member.summary: Specify additional metadata to include in all log entries.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.ServerErrorBackoffDelaySeconds
member.summary: On receiving a server error during log upload, the initial delay in seconds before retry. Defaults value is 1 second.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.ServerErrorBackoffMultiplier
member.summary: The multiplier applied to the retry delay when receiving multiple consecutive server errors during log upload. Default value is 1.5

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.ServerErrorBackoffMaxDelaySeconds
member.summary: The maxmimum retry delay when receiving multiple consecutive server errors during log upload. Default value is 60 seconds.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.GoogleStackdriverAppender.DisposeTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: The maximum time the Dispose() call of may take. Default value is 30 seconds.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.MetaDataType
member.summary: Types of metadata that can be attached to log events.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.MetaDataType.Location
member.summary: The code location of the log entry.
member.remarks:
This will add the following to labels to every log entry (if available):
Location.FileName
Location.ClassName
Location.LineNumber

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.MetaDataType.Identity
member.summary: The string name of the identity of the current thread principal; with the label "Identity".

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.MetaDataType.ThreadName
member.summary: The name of the current thread, or the thread ID when the name is not avaible; with the label "ThreadName".

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.MetaDataType.UserName
member.summary: The name of the current user, or "NOT AVAILABLE"; with the label "UserName".

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.MetaDataType.Domain
member.summary: The AppDomain friendly name; with the label "Domain".

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.MetaDataType.LoggerName
member.summary: The name of the logger that logged the event; with the label "LoggerName".

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.MetaDataType.Level
member.summary: The Level of the logging event; with the label "Level".

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.LocalQueueType
member.summary: Whether log events are queued in memory or to disk. Only in-memory is currently supported.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.LocalQueueType.Memory
member.summary: Queue log events in memory before sending to Cloud Logging. Unsent log events will be lost on program crash.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.ILogQueue.GetPreviousExecutionIdAsync
member.summary: Get the latest ID used in a possible previous execution.
member.returns: The latest ID from a previous exeuction, or null if not relevant.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.ILogQueue.Enqueue(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.LogEntryExtra})
member.summary: Enqueue the given log entries.
member.remarks: This enqueues log entries in a local buffer, which are then asynchronously uploaded to Google Stackdriver. If the local buffer is full, then the oldest locally buffered log entries will be purged to allow these newer entries to be buffered.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.ILogQueue.PeekAsync(System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Peek up to the specified maximum number of items.
member.param: The maximum number of items to retrieve.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A task representing the async operation. The result of the task contains the enumerable of requested items, and any lost datetime-range.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.ILogQueue.RemoveUntilAsync(System.Int64,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Remove items up to and including the specified internal sequential ID.
member.param: The internal sequential ID to remove until.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A task that completes when the removal operation is complete.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.LogQueuePeekResult
member.summary: Contains the result of peeking the local log queue: Log entries to send; and the datetime-range of lost log entries, if relevant.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.LogQueuePeekResult.Entries
member.summary: Log entries to send.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.LogQueuePeekResult.Lost
member.summary: If not null, the datetime-range of lost log entries; null if no log entries have been lost.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Logging.Log4Net.LogUploader
member.summary: Background task that uploads log entries to Google Logging from the local queue.
member.remarks: LogUploader waits for log entries to be available in the queue, then retrieves a batch of log entries from the queue and attempts to upload them to Google Logging. When it is confirmed that these entries have been uploaded successfully, the entries are removed from the queue. If Google Logging is unavailable for any reason, upload is retried indefinitely will exponential backoff up to a configured maxmimum.
